intro: Hieracium spathophyllum, commonly known as the broad-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy stems. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with basal leaves that are broad and often lobed. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, blooming from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and wastelands.
